5 - The Work Among the Colored People

Periodical: The Review and Herald
September 21, 1905
Dear Brethren and Sisters:
     I greatly desire to impress your minds with the importance of doing what you can to help forward the work for the colored people in the Southern States. In this field
66
there are thousands and thousands of Negroes, many of whom are ignorant and in need of the gospel. Upon the white people of the United States the Lord has laid the burden of uplifting this race. But, as yet, Seventh-day Adventists have done comparatively little to help them.
